text: how do you create a positive and
inclusive team culture if your team is
fully remote it is possible but it's
going to take a little more effort so
here are three tips from our authors
this can happen anytime that works best
for the majority of your team members it
can include things like one-on-one
meetings to talk about projects or even
activities like group yoga sessions the
positive memories from that one week can
create a really solid foundation for
your virtual team to grow from so if you
want people to bond you might try to get
them all together and play a virtual
game but think Beyond things like Bingo
or trivia instead consider critical
thinking games that present some kind of
unusual problem like surviving a moon
crash or going on an Arctic Expedition
these kind of exercises allow people to
really work together and also practice
strategic thinking skills so this one is
pretty simple but if you have a weekly
or repeating team meeting just reserve
the first few minutes for casual
conversation it's a great time for your
virtual team members to get to know one
another on a more personal level and
talk about their interests and lives
outside of work
